Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of dismissal of refugee claim based on inadequate state protection
Credibility_Assessment: Claimant's fear of persecution assessed as not credible due to lack of evidence
Evidence_Type: Lack of hard evidence of police corruption or failure to protect
Legal_Provision: Section 97(1) of IRPA – Basis for refugee protection
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution due to involvement as a witness in a bank robbery case in Mexico
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Insufficient evidence to rebut presumption of state protection
Proceeding_Type: Refugee hearing, followed by judicial review
Regulation_Cited: IRPR Section 101(1)(b) – Country conditions and state protection
Legal_Standard: Onus on claimant to prove insufficient state protection
Decision_Review_Issue: Adequacy of analysis of country conditions
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Presumption of state protection unless clearly rebutted
Outcome_of_Review: Dismissed – no error in decision-making process
Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to provide sufficient evidence of state inability or unwillingness to protect
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of documentary or testimonial evidence supporting systemic police corruption
Credibility_Issues: Claimant's assertions not supported by objective evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to sufficiency of country condition analysis
Relevant_Law: Canadian immigration law, international refugee law
